question: (For each, tell me how much confidence you have in each leader to do the right thing regarding world affairs — a lot of confidence, some confidence, not too much confidence or no confidence at all.)...Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe
raw_output:
I would choose some confidence because while Shinzo Abe was generally seen as a strong leader who prioritized Japan’s national interests and maintained good diplomacy, there were concerns related to his domestic policies and certain regional tensions, which temper my overall confidence in his ability to consistently do the right thing regarding world affairs.

ANSWER: B
